entry.title: Clean Core level c sql update query on eket
entry.content:
Hello,

currently we are make our product clean core level c ready. To do that, we have to eliminate some old update queries on some tables. The tables are eket, konm and konp . To get to level c, we are not allowed to do these operations directly on the data base instead i was told that we should use the view i_purordschedulelineapi01 .  When I try to use the query on this view, my IDE is telling me "√Ñnderungsoperation auf dieser Entit√§t sind noch nicht unterst√ºtzt". (on english "changing operations on this entity are not available yet") . Does anybody know an alternative (something like a badi or another view) that i can use? Furthermore the view is not tagged as writeable.

The same goes for the other data bases konm and konp. The successors are I_SlsPrcgCndnRecordScale and I_SlsPrcgConditionRecord. This views are also not writeable and ill get the same error message.

Thanks for any help in advance

entry.title: New "Responsible" Document Attribute & Enhanced Notification Features
entry.content:
New Document Attribute: ‚ÄúResponsible‚Äù

A new optional document attribute called "Responsible" is now available under the Additional Information tab in your document editor.

Purpose: The "Responsible" field is intended to designate the person accountable for the document, separate from the Owner, who may be the document creator or administrator.

Validation Rule: The Responsible and Owner must be different users. Assigning the same person to both roles will result in an error message.

Expanded Document Notification Types

To keep you better informed about document updates, we've added three new types of user notifications for anyone authorized to edit documents:

  1. Documents: assigned to you
  2. Documents: status changed
  3. Documents: content changed

These notifications help users stay on top of important changes in shared documentation.

When Notifications Are Triggered:

Event

Notified Users

Details

Status Change

Owner & Responsible

Triggered when document status changes.

Content Change

Owner & Responsible

Triggered when internal document content or external file is updated.

Assignee Change

Owner & Responsible

Triggered when Owner or Responsible changes.

Approval Started

Other role(s) in approval procedure

Informs reviewers that the document needs attention.

Note: The user who made the change will not receive a notification, as they are already aware of the action taken.

Email vs. In-App Notifications

  • If email notifications are enabled, users will receive a detailed email containing:
    • What changed (status, content, assignee, etc.)
    • A direct link to the document
  • If only in-app notifications are enabled:
    • Users will see a notification with the change type and a link to the document

entry.title: Re: Impact on third party job boards after mingration of...
entry.content:
Hello @Akanksha622 

Yes we had deployed the UDM back in June.

For the third-party job feeds there is some work there that needed to be done to XML feeds if you are allowing for multi-location posting with the UDM update. The XML will need to be updated to pass those values to the vendors as you will need to alert your job vendors of this change as well so they can prepare on their end. 

We have 2 XMLs that needed to be updated, our LinkedIN and Direct Employers to accomodate multi-location posting. The Indeed XML was not update as they do not support multi-location postings so that one was unchanged.

I hope this helps please let me know if you have any further questions.

Have a great day!

Paddy Koltsaklis

entry.title: Re: Stop using Mail Package! ¬© - Simplify your mail receiver adapter scenarios
entry.content:
For anyone trying this out with an FTP -> Mail instead of SFTP -> Mail, the Mail adapter will not properly set the filename.

There is probably a workaround, but if you find yourself frustrated with email attachments called "MainDocument.xml" or "ATT00001.xml", my honest suggestion is to avoid using the FTP adapter, and do whatever you have to do to use SFTP instead.

I figure the reason is that the Mail adapter looks for the attribute parameter ("http://sap.com/xi/XI/System", "FileName), while the FTP adapter does not set this like the SFTP adapter, but instead sets ("http://sap.com/xi/XI/System/File", "FileName").

Why SAP did not make the Mail adapter to check both of these when deciding the filename? Your guess is as good as mine...

entry.title: New tutorial for UI5 Middleware FE Mockserver
entry.content:
A new hands-on tutorial is now available to accompany the Devtoberfest session UI5 Middleware FE Mockserver in Practice ‚Äî Setup, Use Cases, Live Coding. It‚Äôs a guided, step-by-step journey showing how to use @sap-ux/ui5-middleware-fe-mockserver productively with Fiori Elements and beyond covering setup, data strategies, actions, multi-service scenarios, tenant isolation, offline E2E testing with wdi5, and recording real backend traffic for offline replay.

Why this tutorial matters

The mockserver lets you develop and test Fiori apps locally and offline with metadata-accurate data, predictable scenarios, and action implementations without waiting on backend availability. The tutorial distills best practices into small exercises you can run immediately.

What you‚Äôll learn (exercise overview)

ExerciseFocusKey Takeaways
1. Basic Setup ‚Äì Generated DataZero-config mock data from metadataStart fast; remove backend proxy for true offline; draft simulation
2. Custom JSON DataPredictable datasetsStable testing scenarios; relationships; consistent IDs and referential keys
3. JavaScript LogicDynamic data + actionsImplement getInitialDataSet and executeAction; validations; latency simulation
4. Multiple ServicesBookshop + ReviewsMicroservices-style config with distinct metadata and datasets
5. Cross-Service CommunicationService-to-service flowsTrigger operations across services (e.g., promotion creates review)
6. Context-Based IsolationTenant-specific dataUse ?sap-client= to switch tenants; optional tenant-aware logic
7. Error HandlingBusiness and system errorsReturn 400/404/422/500/501 with helpful messages for UI testing
8. Offline E2E Testingwdi5 + mockserverReliable CI-ready tests without backend dependency
9. Record Live ODataui5-middleware-odata-recorderCapture real backend traffic ‚Üí generate mock datasets for offline replay

How to get started

The tutorial is available in the README and is designed to run locally in small, focused apps per exercise. You‚Äôll find commands, file locations, and ready-to-run configurations.

  • Tutorial (GitHub README): ui5-fe-mockserver-tutorial
  • Open UX OData repository: github.com/SAP/open-ux-odata  |  Docs: API & guides
  • Mockserver API references: getInitialDataSet  |  base API
  • OData traffic recorder: ui5-middleware-odata-recorder  |  documentation
  • Generate a Fiori Elements app (optional): Create App with Fiori Tools  |  EasyUI5 Generator

Session context

This tutorial was introduced in the Devtoberfest session UI5 Middleware FE Mockserver in Practice ‚Äî Setup, Use Cases, Live Coding, featuring live coding around configuration, data providers, offline mode, tenant-specific datasets with fallbacks, cross-service scenarios, and wdi5 integration for robust E2E tests. You can rewatch the session now.

Links

  • Devtoberfest event page: Session details
  • Devtoberfest event: YouTube Live Stream
  • Tutorial (GitHub README): ui5-fe-mockserver-tutorial
  • Open UX OData repo & docs: Repository  |  Documentation
  • Recorder middleware: GitHub  |  README

entry.title: What is SAP's vision on "assignment types" in LMS
entry.content:
We rely on different assignment types, which were prominently displayed in LMS legacy view, but in ILX, these assignments type distinctions are being ignored and overruled by the new ILX concept (required, important or invest in myself). However, a.o. for legal reasons, we need to differentiate and report on "required by law" and "required by company rules".
We were promised a full parity between the old LMS Home page and new ILX, before the legacy homepage was going to be deprecated, however, we are still missing:

  1. a search functionality, because most employees have no idea how a course was assigned to them and in which section to search
  2. the clear display of which assignment type was used

What is SAP's vision on "assignment types" for LMS? Will this be restored or will the usage of "assignment types" as we experienced in the legacy view be deprecated? Because for the latter it means we urgently need to push for a completely new mindset within our company on how to publish & assign courses.

Many thanks
Emanuel

entry.title: Re: Update Custom CBO from BADI
entry.content: Hi Experts, We are facing an issue while integrating a Custom Business Object (CBO) with an outbound service via BADI implementation. The same GET and POST requests work successfully in Postman, returning status code 200 OK and updating data as expected. However, when executed via BADI, although the status code is 200, the x-csrf-token is not being fetched during the GET request, and the POST request does not update the data. We have followed the recommended logic and setup for outbound service in CBO. We have two specific questions: Is it mandatory to pass Authorization headers (e.g., Basic Auth or OAuth) in BADI calls? Why is the x-csrf-token not being returned in the GET response via BADI, even though it works in Postman? Any guidance or suggestions to resolve this would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: Leave donation from one employee to another? In Time off
entry.content: You should be able to do it through a Quota Correction (IT2013) with a note to explain who the Quota was transferred to and who received it, but you should first check the legal requirements of such a transfer and it's fiscal implications.

entry.title: Re: Change message type ME175 in ME35K
entry.content:
In that case, use the Where-Used List via SE91, to locate where ME175 is raised. Check for an implicit enhancement point near that line. If available, use it to:

  • Intercept the logic before the message is raised.
  • Add a condition to suppress the error and raise a warning instead.

entry.title: Re: Win-Win-Win Situation: How SAP Customers and Partners can connect with the Academia
entry.content:
Inspiring post, Isadora! It really captures the "Win-Win-Win" synergy of the SAP University Alliances program. Fostering talent, sharing knowledge, and driving innovation is what's needed to prepare the next generation of (SAP) professionals.

Highlighting some of the highly effective ways I've seen this academia-meets-industry collaboration truly flourish:

Connecting at SAP UA Academic Conferences: Natural meeting points where industry professionals presenting case studies, expressing talent needs, and participating in panel duscussions are powerful ways to bridge practice and education.

Utilizing the established network of SAP UA Faculty Coordinators to officially disseminate internship and job opportunities ensures that the information reaches the most qualified, skilled students directly and efficiently. This formalizes the talent pipeline and creates a clear pathway from the classroom to a career.

Joint events: Collaborating with SAP clubs and student associations on campus, such as hosting "Tech Talk" evenings or career panels, makes the industry tangible and accessible to students right where they are.

Motivational in-class visits: A dynamic in-class visit from an industry leader can transform a theoretical lesson into a practical, career-shaping moment for students.

Co-coaching at ERPsim challenges and competitions: Having co-coaches from SAP customers or partners work alongside faculty to mentor student teams provides unparalleled, real-time business strategy training and immediate industry exposure for students.

These are some of the activities which translate into concrete, measurable impact initiatives to ensure the academic curriculum remains relevant and industry-ready.

A question for the community:
What is the most impactful way SAP customers could start engaging with academia today to see the quickest return on investment in talent?

entry.title: Re: Miro enhancement
entry.content:
To fulfill your FI requirement‚Äîautomatically transferring the Contract Number (EKKO-KONNR) from the Purchase Order (PO) into the invoice line item field (BSEG-VERTN) during MIRO/MIR7‚Äîyou‚Äôll need to implement an enhancement that bridges MM and FI data during invoice posting. This enables F110 to consolidate payments by contract using BSEG-VERTN and the BP Regrouping Key.

You can try with BAdI MM_IV_LINE_ITEM, method PROCESS_ITEM. This BAdI is triggered during invoice posting and allows modification of line item data before FI document creation. Implementation Logic:

  • Read the PO number from the invoice item (RBKP/RBEP).
  • Use EKKO to fetch KONNR (contract number).
  • Assign KONNR to BSEG-VERTN.

entry.title: App Support - App Inspector now available from the Fiori Launchpad Home
entry.content:
If you support SAP Fiori users, you know the drill: a user reports ‚Äúmy app doesn‚Äôt open,‚Äù but your technical user doesn‚Äôt have that business role, or you‚Äôre on the Home screen wondering where to start. With the latest version of S/4 HANA 2025, you can launch App Inspector directly from the Fiori Launchpad Home via the familiar App Support entry ‚Äì and immediately browse a complete catalog of all applications available in the system, regardless of your assigned roles.

This builds on the App Support for SAP Fiori Launchpad capability described in the previous blog, and extends it with a system-wide catalog and more powerful search so supporters can find and troubleshoot any app faster.

What‚Äôs new

  • Same entry point, now usable from the Home screen Open the user menu on the Fiori Launchpad Home and choose App Support. No need to launch a specific app first.

  • Complete catalog of all apps in the system Browse everything available in the system, independent of your role assignments. Ideal for technical triage and landscape visibility.

  • More technical information for in-house support Quickly see technical identifiers and configuration details useful for troubleshooting (for example: Fiori app ID, component, intent, target mapping source, system alias, OData service, and more within App Inspector).

  • Powerful search Find apps by user, Fiori ID, Role, or Catalog ID. This helps you locate exactly the app a business user is referring to, even if you don‚Äôt have the same role assignment.

Access App Support - App Inspector through the Fiori Launchpad Home Screen

 

How it works

  1. From the Fiori Launchpad Home, open the user menu and select App Support.
  2. The App Support catalog view opens, listing all applications available in the system.
  3. Use search to locate an app:
    • By user: enter a user to see apps available for them.
    • By Fiori ID: use the SAP Fiori app ID you received in a ticket (for example, F1234).
    • By Role: search by a PFCG role name.
    • By Catalog ID: search by Fiori Launchpad catalog ID to review content organization.
  4. Select an application to open details. From there, launch App Inspector to analyze technical configuration and resolve issues such as:
    • Intent resolution and target mapping
    • Component and application version
    • System alias and destination
    • OData service bindings and backend availability
  5. Use deep links to open the app or share a link with colleagues. Capture findings and next steps directly from the Inspector view.

 

 

App Inspector list with filter options

Typical support scenarios this streamlines

  • A user reports an issue with a specific Fiori app ID. Search by Fiori ID, open the app details, and run App Inspector to verify configuration, intent, target mapping, and backend connectivity.

  • A supporter needs to confirm whether an app is present in the system and how it is exposed. Use the catalog and role or catalog search to see availability and assignments, even without business roles.

  • Triage ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt find my app‚Äù tickets. Search by user to compare what the user should see against catalog contents and identify role/catalog gaps.

  • Validate transports or configuration changes. Use App Inspector to check app versions and content source.

Detail view of an app in App Inspector

Availability and prerequisites

  • Entry point: App Support in the user menu on the Fiori Launchpad Home screen.
  • Feature set: App Inspector uses the same base as App Support and provides the technical analysis views described in the SAP Help.
  • Prerequisites: Ensure App Support and App Inspector are available and configured in your ABAP system. Appropriate authorizations are required to access support tooling and system-wide catalog content. For setup and configuration, refer to the SAP Help documentation:  https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/a7b390faab1140c087b8926571e942b7/94d8f974fcda459ea35dedd00c846603.html

Tips for adoption

  • Add App Support to your standard operating procedures for first-line Fiori triage.
  • Train supporters on search strategies (by user, Fiori ID, role, catalog) to shorten time-to-resolution.
  • Use App Inspector findings to create clear handoffs between frontend and backend teams.
  • Consider periodic catalog reviews to detect content inconsistencies across roles and catalogs.

What stays consistent

  • You still access App Support via the same user menu entry. The difference is that you can now start from the Home screen and immediately leverage the catalog without opening a specific app.

We‚Äôd love your feedback

Tell us how the catalog view and App Inspector help your support process. Which searches do you use most? What additional technical details would speed up your troubleshooting activities even more?

Further reading

  • App Support for the SAP Fiori Launchpad (previous blog): https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/app-support-for-the-sap-fiori-launchpad/ba-p/13487591
  • App Inspector documentation: https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/a7b390faab1140c087b8926571e942b7/9306ad5bca61445089f1c901196b8135.html

With App Support now accessible from the Fiori Launchpad Home and a complete application catalog at your fingertips, supporters can locate, inspect, and resolve issues faster‚Äîwithout the overhead of business role assignments.

entry.title: SAP CodeJam HANA ML in Porto 2025-09 Recap
entry.content:
At the end of September, we held an SAP CodeJam event in Vila Nova de Gaia, Portugal. The event focused on exploring the foundations of AI applications with the SAP HANA Cloud: Vector Engine and Knowledge Graph Engine.

Thanks to the local host and organizers: @MatheusBrasil , @MRobalinho and the rest of the team...

...and participants!

It was great to have my teammate and fellow developer advocate @qmacro joining us... not only during the lunch break üêü

SAP CodeJam in Porto was the day before the very first SAP Inside Track there, so it was great to share a drink during a Stammtisch after the CodeJam...

 The following day, I had a chance to present the long story of LLM auto completion to AI agents‚Äîwe went in just three years! And invited everyone to join SAP TechEd to watch our Developer Keynote.

November is going to be an intensive month with SAP TechEd on Tour in Berlin, Sydney, and Bengaluru, followed by SAP CodeJams in Melbourne, Singapore, and the Middle East.

I always take the opportunity to experience at least a little bit of the city I am in, so you can see my photos: https://www.instagram.com/p/DPyfRcMDKko/?img_index=1

Would you like to host such an SAP CodeJam?

entry.title: Re: Âú®ËøõË°åÂ∫îÊî∂Ê±áÁ•®ÁöÑÊâπÈáèËÆ§È¢ÜÂØºÂÖ•Êó∂ÔºåÊèêÁ§∫ÊäµÈîÄÁßëÁõÆÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÊèêÁ§∫Êú™Âú®ÂÖ¨Âè∏‰ª£Á†Å‰∏≠ÂÆö‰πâÔºåËØ∑ÊåáÊïô‰∏ãÔºåÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂ§ÑÁêÜÁöÑ
entry.content:
Hello @lemon-xue ,

Thank you for your question and follow-up

The error shows that Offsetting Account Determination is not active for your company's BoE receivable acceptance. In Public Cloud, setup explicitly includes defining versions for Offsetting Account Determination as part of the BoE configuration.  SAP Help Portal-Bill of Exchange Process Overview (CN)

Refer to below SAP KBA documentation below for possible solutions

3019897 ‚Äì The Offsetting account cannot be determined in the document
It explains why the system cannot find an offsetting account and guides you to the necessary setup, including using Determine Offsetting Accounts Manually ‚Äì China when automatic determination is not yet configured. SAP Support Portal-3019897 - Offsetting account cannot be determined in document&1&2&3

If you still encounter issues after setup or manual pairing, these two KBAs will assist with troubleshooting.

3461513 ‚Äì How to manually determine offsetting accounts (step-by-step for the China apps). SAP Support Portal-3461513 - How to manually determine the offsetting accounts?

3461466 ‚Äì After manual determination, the journal entry is still not in the cash flow (what you should check next). SAP Support Portal-3461466 - After manually determining the offsetting accounts, the journal entry still did not appear in the cash flow statements

For configuration, including activating and maintaining versions and rules, see SAP Help Configuring Offsetting Account Determination. SAP Help-Configuring Offsetting Account Determination

entry.title: Re: SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025
entry.content:
Hi @BinWang 

Developer users do not need to be assigned to the IAS group j4a-admin.
Assigning the admin users to this j4a-admin group in IAS gives them access to the Maintain Certificate Mapping app, which is required to generate the one-time password (OTP) needed for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud system configuration ( please see above, step 8 )
Developers users need the SAP_BR_DEVELOPER role. 

Best,
Sebastian

entry.title: Re: Schema categories shows the blank Names and Descripti...
entry.content:
Hi Srinivas,

I can see from the Text File that the language is indicated as EN.
Without having access to the actual system, it's quite hard to analyze anything.
But:
Since the Schema has to exist before the import (empty shell), the logical conclusion would be, that the translation (the empty shell of it) also has to exist before the import.
Meaning, you probably have to somehow indicate that there's a second language in order for the import in another language to work. --> Maybe translate at least the root node.
However that's just my best guess.

Kind regards
Richard

entry.title: Error when trying to display APPS - Joule in SAP S/4HANA Public Edition
entry.content:
Hi everyone!

I‚Äôm currently using Joule inside SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, and when I ask Joule to show a Sales Order, I get the following error:

 

There are no intents, current user is authorized to (check BTP navigation service is up-to-date),
Source: GET, /navigation/api/v2/inbounds?pageSize=1000000,
user 'user@email.com', semantic object type 'salesOrder'.
 OBS: Generic Email for security

The Manage Sales Orders app appears and works normally in the SAP Fiori Launchpad, so the app itself is available.
It seems the issue is that Joule cannot find the intent or inbound for the salesOrder semantic object.

I also tried accessing /navigation/api/v2/inbounds, but received the following response:

403 Forbidden - The request has been blocked by UCON.

I‚Äôd like to understand if anyone has faced a similar issue.current limitations of Joule integration in S/4HANA Public Edition?

Any insights, suggestions, or experiences would be greatly appreciated üôè

entry.title: Re: Page Map error
entry.content:
Hello,

I was able to fix it on my side. In my manifest.json, under dataSources, I have "localUri" entries that are used by Page Map.

One of the XML files was not in my localService folder (the service annotation file ***_ANNO_MDL.xml).

I downloaded it from the backend and placed it in the localService folder. After that, I was able to open Page Map.

For your information, the error was displayed in the Output section (near Terminal) for SAP Fiori tools ‚Äì Application Modeler.

Best regards,

Severin

entry.title: Re: Determining freight costs in the STO transfer process
entry.content:
It seems like requirement is to capture cost on material valuation for STO. This is a standard functionality. Add a cost condition in STO pricing schema. Cost will be distributed based on weight. Material valuation should be active. Refer below link for details:

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/sto-freight-cost-loaded-on-material-cost/qaq-p/11837754

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/sto-pricing-procedure/qaq-p/7974940

In case you are using transportation module which does freight cost calculation and posting to ERP, then this requirement can be handle in Transportation module.

entry.title: Re: Wireshark with SAP Dissectors for Ubuntu and macOS
entry.content:
Seems this blog is nowadays "read-only" even for its author (me), maybe due to the change of blog-toolset in SAP Community site in early 2024, I don't know. Anyway, here is some additional information from when I was recently setting up the SAP Dissectors for Wireshark in MacBook case...

Port Numbers

If in the Preferences pane of Wireshark you are offered the chance to modify the port numbers each SAP Dissector applies for, then you would make the modifications according to your needs. For example, in Wireshark for MacBook, I changed the values for the SAP Dissectors as follows: 

SAPDIAG to 3200-3299 (instead of just 3200); SAPMS to 3600,3601,3900 (added in 3601); SAPNI to 3200-3299,40000 (instead of just 3200,40000); SAPRFC to 3300-3399 (instead of just 3300 or just 3301, whatever was initially there). Once you have changed the port numbers to suit, press OK to close the Preferences windows, this will save your changes.

 

Additional commands for MacBook M-series

After using brew to install qt5, it is a good idea to copy the suggested commands in the output info and run those. For example I got this info in Terminal:

If you need to have qt@5 first in your PATH, run:

echo 'export PATH="/opt/homebrew/opt/qt@5/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.zshrc

For compilers to find qt@5 you may need to set:

export LDFLAGS="-L/opt/homebrew/opt/qt@5/lib"

export CPPFLAGS="-I/opt/homebrew/opt/qt@5/include"

For cmake to find qt@5 you may need to set:

export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="/opt/homebrew/opt/qt@5"

By running these, you avoid errors more easily when e.g. using the 'cmake' command. [Note that if you are using a different shell than zsh, it would be up to you to modify the first export command appropriately].

 

Additional commands for Intel MacBooks

The corresponding extra commands on older Intel MacBooks would be something like the following:

If you need to have qt@5 first in your PATH, run:

echo 'export PATH="/usr/local/opt/qt@5/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.zshrc

For compilers to find qt@5 you may need to set:

export LDFLAGS="-L/usr/local/opt/qt@5/lib"

export CPPFLAGS="-I/usr/local/opt/qt@5/include"

For cmake to find qt@5 you may need to set:

export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="/usr/local/opt/qt@5"

entry.title: Re: MIRO transaction PO details is not showing
entry.content:
Hi,
If you're not seeing PO details in the MIRO transaction screen in SAP, here are a few common causes and troubleshooting steps you can try:

Please find the possible reasons and fixes

Missing Goods Receipt (GR):
If the PO is for materials, ensure the GR has been posted. Use transaction MB51 or ME2N to verify GR status.

Service PO without Entry Sheet:
For service POs, you must create a Service Entry Sheet using ML81N before MIRO. Without it, the PO details won't appear.

Incorrect Item Category or Account Assignment:
If the PO uses item category "F" (for services) or has account assignment, ensure all required fields are correctly filled and posted.

User-Specific Authorization Issues:
Sometimes, PO details show for one user but not another. This could be due to missing roles or authorization objects. Compare user roles and authorizations

Our on-prem sandbox has both configured ...

entry.title: Re: Correct config to release returned stock from Blocked...
entry.content:
Hello @SAPSupport 

The system is blocking the manual moving from Blocked to Unrestricted because the stock is still flagged for returns inspection. In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, customer return inspections are managed within the warehouse process, which is why a traditional QM lot would appear in QA32. Instead, record and complete the inspection via Enter Inspection Results from Warehouse. SAP Help Portal-Enter Inspection Results - From Warehouse

To release stock, open Enter Inspection Results from Warehouse (MSR_INSPWH) for the return, record results, set Logistical Follow-Up Activity to 0011 (Transfer to Free Stock), then Save and Confirm. This post stocks to Unrestricted and clears the inspection reference. Using 0031 (No further activities) won't create a posting change and leaves the stock blocked under inspection.  SAP Help Portal-Logistical Follow-Up Activities

  • What you should do?
  • App: Enter Inspection Results ‚Äì From Warehouse (MSR_INSPWH). This is the warehouse inspection app you need for customer returns

Process Inspection Lots ‚Äî App ID: (launchpad). Note that the official name uses the plural form.

Follow-up activity: 0011 ‚Äì Transfer to Free Available Stock. SAP Help Portal-Logistical Follow-Up Activities

Let me know if you need further assistance

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Integration Advisor: Early UN/EDIFACT Versions with Syntax Version 2 Now Available
entry.content:
Today, I would like to share an update regarding the B2B Library versions included in our Integration Advisor (of SAP Integration Suite) offering. Recently, we added three additional UN/EDIFACT versions from the early 1990s. 

Early Versions of the UN/EDIFACT standard

We have added three additional early versions: 90.2 S2, 91.1 S2 and 91.2 S2 ‚Äì bringing the total number of supported UN/EDIFACT versions to 63.

To the best of our knowledge, even older versions (particularly 90.1 S1) are not in productive use. However, please contact us if you require this S1 version, and we will evaluate whether it can be added.

Interoperability of Syntax Version 2 (S2) and Syntax Version 3 (S3)

UN/EDIFACT syntax versions (defined by ISO 9735) are sets of rules specifying the structure of EDIFACT messages. To date, four syntax versions have been published by the UN/ECE organization: S1, S2, S3, and S4.  

These syntax versions are, in a way, orthogonal to the UN/EDIFACT versions / releases (such as 91.2 or D.01B). However, it is common practice to display UN/EDIFACT versions alongside the syntax version that was in use at the time the UN/EDIFACT version was published (e.g., 91.2 S2 or D.01B S3).

Accordingly, Integration Advisor displays all previously published UN/EDIFACT versions with the suffix S3, while the recently added versions are shown with the suffix S2.

It is important to note that syntax versions 2 and 3 are almost identical, differing only in the allowed code pages (UNOA-UNOB for S2 versus UNOA-UNOF for S3) defined in data element UNB > S001 > 0001.

This is why you can also use later UN/EDIFACT versions with syntax version 2 or use earlier UN/EDIFACT versions with syntax version 3.  

Code Values for syntax-related Data Elements  

The UN/EDIFACT standard includes certain core data elements, typically named 00**, which are used in service segments such as UNB, UNG, UNH, UNT, or UNZ. Originally, the UN/ECE organization did not provide code values for some of these core data elements and only began doing so in the mid-1990s.

Integration Advisor strives to publish B2B Library definitions as provided by the standardization organizations. As a result, the recently added UN/EDIFACT versions do not include code values for data elements 0002, 0052, or 0054.

Handling of Code Values associated with UN/CEFACT codelists

Since 1991, UN/ECE has recommended using UN/CEFACT codelists for certain UN/EDIFACT data elements. The table below lists the affected data elements along with their assigned UN/CEFACT codelists: 

Data ElementDescriptionUN/EDIFACT CodelistUN/CEFACT Codelist
4053Delivery or transport terms4053Rec 5
4277Payment terms4277Rec 17
4405Transport status4405Rec 24
6411Measurement units6411Rec 20 
7065Package types7065Rec 21
8023Freight and charges identification8023Rec 23
8067Transport modes8067Rec 19
8179Transport means8179Rec 28

Accordingly, Integration Advisor provides links from these data elements to the latest version of the listed UN/CEFACT recommendations. This applies to all versions of UN/EDIFACT starting from 91.1 S2. (Please note that the UN/EDIFACT standard did not maintain any code values for these data elements in the earlier version 90.2 S2.)

For versions 91.1 S2 and 91.2 S2, we also provide UN/EDIFACT codelists containing the code values as they were originally published by the UN/EDIFACT standard. In your Message Implementation Guideline (MIG), you have the option to use either the original UN/EDIFACT code values or the current UN/CEFACT code values.  

Consumption in Cloud Integration  

Since earlier this year, the Cloud Integration capability of SAP Integration Suite has supported all UN/EDIFACT syntax versions (S1 through S4). This means you can process UN/EDIFACT payloads in all the EDI flow steps, such as EDI Splitter, EDI Extractor, EDI-To-XML Converter, and XML-To-EDI Converter, based on all these syntax versions. 

Note: You need to use the latest version of these EDI flow steps. In your Integration Flow, simply add the EDI flow steps from the palette to ensure you are using the newest version.

For the older UN/EDIFACT versions, there is one additional detail to note: 

  • Since release D.93A S3 in 1993, UN/EDIFACT has used the value D for field UNH > S009 > 0052. As a result, the EDI flow steps expect an XSD file name like UN-EDIFACT_ORDERS_D96A.xsd.
  • However, for releases prior to D.93A S3, other values (such as 1 or 2) were used for field UNH > S009 > 0052. In these cases, the EDI flow steps expect an XSD file name like UN-EDIFACT_ORDERS_2912.xsd.

Integration Advisor has recently added a new field Configure EDIFACT Message Version to tab Runtime Context (of your MIG) where this value can be maintained - see the screenshot below.   

When you create a new Message Implementation Guideline (MIG), Integration Advisor automatically selects an appropriate default value based on the following rules: 

  • Use D as the default value for all UN/EDIFACT versions starting with D (from D.93A onwards) 
  • Use 1 as the default value for all UN/EDIFACT versions not starting with D and having a minor version of 1 (applies to versions 91.1 S2 and 92.1 S3) 
  • Use 2 as the default value for all UN/EDIFACT versions not starting with D and having a minor version of 2 (applies to versions 90.2 S2, 91.2 S2, and 93.2 S3) 

In most cases, the default value should meet your requirements. If not, you can easily redefine this value in your MIG.

Conclusion

With this latest update, Integration Advisor has added three early UN/EDIFACT versions associated with Syntax Version 2. This enables you to build your Message Implementation Guidelines (MIGs) and Mapping Guidelines (MAGs) based on these S2 versions.

Further reading

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-integration/sap-cloud-integration/overview-of-b2b-standards 

https://blogs.sap.com/2021/09/28/integration-advisor-overview-of-components-for-building-b2b-integra...
https://blogs.sap.com/2018/07/13/integration-content-advisor-create-a-customized-interface-using-mig...

entry.title: Re: KSS2-assign splitting structure ERRORÔºö Client 100 has status 'not modifiable' Message no. TK4
entry.content: You‚Äôll usually see that ‚ÄúClient 100 has status ‚Äònot modifiable‚Äô (TK430)‚Äù message when trying to make config-level changes in a client set as Production or No Changes allowed. If you can‚Äôt adjust SCC4, one workaround is to perform the assignment in a customizing client, then transport the change into Client 100. Alternatively, check if you can use SM30 ‚Üí V_TKA09 (depending on authorizations) to adjust splitting structure assignments indirectly. Also make sure you‚Äôre not in a cross-client table when doing it ‚Äî that‚Äôs often why the modifiability restriction triggers.

entry.title: Re: Gathering both Machine and labor time from APO (PA3)
entry.content:
Good day @petrocsek 

Thank you for your question.

To summarise, it is standard that only the scheduling relevant capacity is transferred from ERP work center when integrating APO. Labour time is not transferred automatically. However, you consider the following options:

  • First is to use custom enhancement to capture and store labour time during your CIF transfer.
  • Second option is to model dual resources (machine and Labour) and activate secondary resource transfer in CIF customising.

Alternatively, potential simpler way is for you to maintain labour vs. Machine time reporting directly in ERP through the BW extractors.

Have you had a look at the references for more details.

 How Are the Details of the Order Mapped in SAP APO and SAP R/3?

Integration of Resources

https://community.sap.com/t5/supply-chain-management-q-a/pooled-capacity-in-apo/qaq-p/9901760

 Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: ABAP Cloud Developer Trial 2023 Available Now
entry.content:
Hi @jjairoph ,

To connect to HANA Studio as a plugin in Eclipseyou have to publish the ports 30213 and 30215 in the docker run command. Have you tried this?

If not, if you are a customer / partner (ie have an S-User), the following SAP Note may help:

3260460 - Connection to tenant database failed with error "Database connection is not available" or "host name 'xx' does not match names in certificate" - SAP for Me

Please let me know how you get on.

Thanks and best wishes,
Julie Plummer

ABAP PM.

entry.title: Re: Rewards and Recognition-Remove Redemption Site
entry.content:

there is a currently no possibility to hide the redemption tile, however after a quick chat yesterday with our product team, have you tried not configuring wallets at all ? entry.title: Re: Designing UI5 Apps as Business Solution for SAP Build Work Zone - Part 2
entry.content:
Hi @theodore_abitbol 

yes you do not need to implement everything. If you do not need an embedded reuse component, just remove it.

To help you fixing the 404 I would need more details, e.g. what is the URL of the failing request and what have you done differently to my reference sample?
Also interesting would be, whether you are on an extension landscape. It looks like the URLs in the destinations are not calculated correctly by my MTA.

Best regards
Matthias

entry.title: QM - I need to create a digital signature in the background
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

I need to create a digital signature in the background (i.e. without a GUI dialogue) for QM results recording.  

The ID/password validation will be done in an external application (MII),  then it will call a custom RFC for results recording (which will use the standard RR BAPI).   Given the user ID,  password (passed encrypted) and Inspection Lot/Results details,  I need to generate an accompanying digital signature in the background.

I'm currently digging around the DS package, which looks useful;  but I wondered if anyone else had encountered (and solved) this challenge.

Cheers,

John

entry.title: Re: What exactly is SAP BW PCE‚Ä¶ and what it is not !
entry.content:
Hello Mel,

Your existing BW 7.5 PCE deployment in US20 can stay where it is, regardless where the public cloud components of BDC are deployed. That's because there's no co-location requirement for the private and public component services.

Your SAP sales team can help you restructure your existing contract to fit the BW landscape under the BDC commercial umbrella and with that, you'd have access to the Data Product Generator. In addition,  you can plan for a reduction of the BW landscape (aka scale-down) , free up the BW-dedicated capacity units, and then use them for the public cloud component services.

I hope this helps,
Karsten
